titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of eight binders of genealogical research compiled by Pauline J. (Carr) Smith entitled "Carr Taylor Family Connections." The binders include genealogical information about the Carr and Taylor families of Iowa and numerous related families, primarily from the Midwest. These volumes resemble scrapbooks with photocopies of primary sources and genealogical information interspersed throughout in a largely unsystematic way. The bulk of the documentation consists of family group sheets that list family members and births, deaths, and marriages; there are also a number of photocopies of photographs, newspaper articles, and unusual items like sheet music or individual pieces of correspondence. It is not always clear how the family data and other information is related and sources are often not cited. The binders appear to have been compiled in the 1990s.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
